speaker: SATURNINUS
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: SATURNINUS
text_entry: SCENE I. Rome. Before the Palace.

speaker: SATURNINUS
text_entry: Enter AARON

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Now climbeth Tamora Olympus' top,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Safe out of fortune's shot; and sits aloft,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Secure of thunder's crack or lightning flash;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Advanced above pale envy's threatening reach.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: As when the golden sun salutes the morn,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And, having gilt the ocean with his beams,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Gallops the zodiac in his glistering coach,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And overlooks the highest-peering hills;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: So Tamora:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Upon her wit doth earthly honour wait,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And virtue stoops and trembles at her frown.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Then, Aaron, arm thy heart, and fit thy thoughts,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To mount aloft with thy imperial mistress,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And mount her pitch, whom thou in triumph long

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Hast prisoner held, fetter'd in amorous chains

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And faster bound to Aaron's charming eyes

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Than is Prometheus tied to Caucasus.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Away with slavish weeds and servile thoughts!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: I will be bright, and shine in pearl and gold,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To wait upon this new-made empress.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To wait, said I? to wanton with this queen,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This goddess, this Semiramis, this nymph,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This siren, that will charm Rome's Saturnine,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And see his shipwreck and his commonweal's.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Holloa! what storm is this?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Enter DEMETRIUS and CHIRON, braving

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Chiron, thy years want wit, thy wit wants edge,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: And manners, to intrude where I am graced;

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: And may, for aught thou know'st, affected be.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Demetrius, thou dost over-ween in all;

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: And so in this, to bear me down with braves.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: 'Tis not the difference of a year or two

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Makes me less gracious or thee more fortunate:

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: I am as able and as fit as thou

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: To serve, and to deserve my mistress' grace;

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: And that my sword upon thee shall approve,

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: And plead my passions for Lavinia's love.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: [Aside]  Clubs, clubs! these lovers will not keep

speaker: AARON
text_entry: the peace.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Why, boy, although our mother, unadvised,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Gave you a dancing-rapier by your side,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Are you so desperate grown, to threat your friends?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Go to; have your lath glued within your sheath

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Till you know better how to handle it.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Meanwhile, sir, with the little skill I have,

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Full well shalt thou perceive how much I dare.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Ay, boy, grow ye so brave?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: They draw

speaker: AARON
text_entry: [Coming forward]  Why, how now, lords!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: So near the emperor's palace dare you draw,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And maintain such a quarrel openly?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Full well I wot the ground of all this grudge:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: I would not for a million of gold

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The cause were known to them it most concerns;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Nor would your noble mother for much more

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Be so dishonour'd in the court of Rome.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: For shame, put up.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Not I, till I have sheathed

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: My rapier in his bosom and withal

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Thrust these reproachful speeches down his throat

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: That he hath breathed in my dishonour here.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: For that I am prepared and full resolved.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Foul-spoken coward, that thunder'st with thy tongue,

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: And with thy weapon nothing darest perform!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Away, I say!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Now, by the gods that warlike Goths adore,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This petty brabble will undo us all.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, lords, and think you not how dangerous

speaker: AARON
text_entry: It is to jet upon a prince's right?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: What, is Lavinia then become so loose,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Or Bassianus so degenerate,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That for her love such quarrels may be broach'd

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Without controlment, justice, or revenge?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Young lords, beware! and should the empress know

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This discord's ground, the music would not please.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: I care not, I, knew she and all the world:

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: I love Lavinia more than all the world.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Youngling, learn thou to make some meaner choice:

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Lavinia is thine elder brother's hope.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, are ye mad? or know ye not, in Rome

speaker: AARON
text_entry: How furious and impatient they be,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And cannot brook competitors in love?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: I tell you, lords, you do but plot your deaths

speaker: AARON
text_entry: By this device.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Aaron, a thousand deaths

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Would I propose to achieve her whom I love.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To achieve her! how?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Why makest thou it so strange?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: She is a woman, therefore may be woo'd;

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: She is a woman, therefore may be won;

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: She is Lavinia, therefore must be loved.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: What, man! more water glideth by the mill

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Than wots the miller of; and easy it is

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Of a cut loaf to steal a shive, we know:

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Though Bassianus be the emperor's brother.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Better than he have worn Vulcan's badge.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: [Aside]  Ay, and as good as Saturninus may.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Then why should he despair that knows to court it

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: With words, fair looks and liberality?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: What, hast not thou full often struck a doe,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: And borne her cleanly by the keeper's nose?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, then, it seems, some certain snatch or so

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Would serve your turns.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Ay, so the turn were served.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Aaron, thou hast hit it.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Would you had hit it too!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Then should not we be tired with this ado.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, hark ye, hark ye! and are you such fools

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To square for this? would it offend you, then

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That both should speed?

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Faith, not me.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Nor me, so I were one.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: For shame, be friends, and join for that you jar:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: 'Tis policy and stratagem must do

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That you affect; and so must you resolve,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That what you cannot as you would achieve,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: You must perforce accomplish as you may.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Take this of me: Lucrece was not more chaste

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Than this Lavinia, Bassianus' love.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: A speedier course than lingering languishment

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Must we pursue, and I have found the path.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: My lords, a solemn hunting is in hand;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: There will the lovely Roman ladies troop:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The forest walks are wide and spacious;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And many unfrequented plots there are

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Fitted by kind for rape and villany:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Single you thither then this dainty doe,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And strike her home by force, if not by words:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This way, or not at all, stand you in hope.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Come, come, our empress, with her sacred wit

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To villany and vengeance consecrate,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Will we acquaint with all that we intend;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And she shall file our engines with advice,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That will not suffer you to square yourselves,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: But to your wishes' height advance you both.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The emperor's court is like the house of Fame,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The palace full of tongues, of eyes, and ears:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The woods are ruthless, dreadful, deaf, and dull;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: There speak, and strike, brave boys, and take

speaker: AARON
text_entry: your turns;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: There serve your lusts, shadow'd from heaven's eye,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And revel in Lavinia's treasury.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Thy counsel, lad, smells of no cowardice,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Sit fas aut nefas, till I find the stream

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: To cool this heat, a charm to calm these fits.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Per Styga, per manes vehor.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
